A randomized trial comparing the efficacy of 2 drugs showed a difference between the 2 (with a p value < 0.05). Assume that in reality, however, the 2 drugs don’t differ. This is:
After applying a statistical test, an investigator gets the p value as 0.01 it means that

options.label: A
options.text: Probability of finding a significant difference is 1%

options.label: B
options.text: Probability of declaring a significant difference is 1%

options.label: C
options.text: Difference not significant 1% times and significant 99% times

questions.correct_answer: C. Difference not significant 1% times and significant 99% times
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation: p value is 0.01; it means that the probability of committing type-1 error is only 1%
  • • So, 99% chance is that there is significant difference present between two interventions, which means we can reject null hypothesis and accept alternate hypothesis.
  • • So, the best answer will be c
  • • So, the best answer will be c
